title: Add devdash agent-setup command
description: Auto-detect AI coding agents and write config files so they know to use devdash for task tracking

title: Add devdash agent-setup command for multi-agent onboarding
description: Create a devdash agent-setup command that auto-detects and configures AI coding agents (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, GitHub Copilot, Cline, OpenAI Codex, etc.) to use devdash for task tracking. Writes canonical instructions to .devdash/agent-instructions.md and wires into each agent's native config mechanism. Update GETTING-STARTED.md.

title: Add GETTING-STARTED.md onboarding guide
description: Created a friendly step-by-step onboarding guide covering install, auth, project setup (web + CLI paths), daily workflow, AI agent integration, multi-repo config, and troubleshooting. Linked from README.md.

title: Offer dd alias setup during devdash init
description: Added dd_maybe_offer_alias helper that prompts users to set up the dd shortcut alias at the end of devdash init, after successfully linking a project. Skips silently in non-interactive environments and when already configured. Improves onboarding flow.

title: Fix postinstall crash on Node v24+ for GitHub-based npm install
description: npm install -g github:jasonmassey/devdash-cli crashes on Node v24+/npm 11 because npm spawns the postinstall shell with a CWD that doesn't exist. Fixed by removing the postinstall script entirely — the alias setup it provided is already available via devdash alias-setup.

title: Fix: init crashed silently when repo had no origin remote
description: pipefail + git remote get-url origin failure caused silent exit 2. Fixed with || remote= fallback.

title: Configure npm auth and NPM_TOKEN GitHub secret for publishing
description: npm whoami fails with ENEEDAUTH, and gh secret list shows no NPM_TOKEN. Need to: 1) npm login to authenticate, 2) Generate npm token and set as GitHub secret via gh secret set NPM_TOKEN. Blocks v0.2.0 publish.

title: Multi-project developer environment support
description: Developers work on multiple projects on the same machine. Current behavior: .devdash file in repo root sets project_id and api_url, but this creates friction when switching between projects. Issues to solve: (1) Agent sessions (Claude Code) start in one project dir but may reference another project's tasks — the .devdash config is tied to cwd, (2) 'devdash init' overwrites .devdash if switching projects, (3) No way to quickly switch active project context without cd-ing to a different repo, (4) Multiple repos might map to the same devdash project (monorepo subtrees). Possible approaches: (a) 'devdash project switch <name>' that updates a global active project in ~/.config/dev-dash/active-project, (b) DD_PROJECT_ID env var already works as override — document and promote this, (c) project name aliases in ~/.config/dev-dash/projects.json for quick reference, (d) 'devdash context' command that shows which project is active and why (from .devdash, env var, or global default). Consider how this interacts with the prime command output — the agent context needs to know the right project.

title: Add --json output flag for machine-readable output
description: All commands currently output human-formatted text. Add a global --json flag that outputs raw JSON for scripting/piping. Useful for: CI/CD integration, piping to jq, programmatic consumption by other tools. Pattern: check for --json in args, if set skip formatting and echo raw API response. Applies to: list, ready, blocked, show, stats, jobs.

title: Add local bead ID cache for faster lookups
description: Short UUID prefix matching (bin/devdash lines 101-122) and dev-dash-* ID resolution (lines 82-92) fetch all beads from the API on every call. For large projects this is slow. Add a local cache file (~/.config/dev-dash/cache/<project-id>.json) that maps short IDs and dev-dash-* IDs to full UUIDs. Invalidate on create/update/close. Reduces API calls for repeated show/update operations.

title: Initial npm publish (v0.2.0)
description: Package has never been published to npm despite v0.2.0 version bump and GitHub Actions release workflow. Steps: (1) verify NPM_TOKEN secret is configured in GitHub repo settings, (2) ensure package.json metadata is correct (name, description, keywords, repository, license), (3) either publish manually with 'npm publish --access public' or push a v0.2.0 git tag to trigger the release workflow, (4) verify install works with 'npm install -g devdash-cli'. Blocked by: committing changes, README update, error handling, tests.

title: README update for v0.2.0 publish
description: README.md exists (95 lines) but needs review before publish: (1) verify all commands match current implementation, (2) add project create/list commands (added in v0.2.0), (3) add reconcile-tasks command docs, (4) add examples for common workflows, (5) add troubleshooting section (doctor output, common errors), (6) verify npm install instructions work. File: README.md.

title: Add basic integration tests
description: No tests exist. Add basic integration tests that verify: (1) help output includes all commands, (2) version output matches package.json, (3) doctor runs without error when prerequisites are met, (4) commands without auth print login prompt, (5) create/update/close with mock server or test project. Could use bats (Bash Automated Testing System) or simple bash test script. CI already runs shellcheck; add test step to release workflow.

title: Add delete command for projects and beads
description: No delete command exists. Need: (1) 'devdash delete <bead-id>' to delete a single bead (call DELETE /api/beads/:id), (2) 'devdash project delete <project-id>' to delete a project (call DELETE /api/projects/:id) with confirmation prompt. Add --force flag to skip confirmation for scripting.

title: Login port fallback when 18787 is busy
description: Login flow starts Python HTTP server on fixed port 18787 (bin/devdash lines 142-207). If port is already in use, login fails silently. Fix: try port 18787 first, if EADDRINUSE try a few alternates (18788-18792), pass the actual port to the OAuth redirect URL. Also consider: timeout if browser callback never arrives, cleanup of Python server process on Ctrl+C.

title: Improve error handling and exit codes
description: Error handling is minimal throughout. curl -sf silences errors, making failures invisible. Issues: (1) API errors return empty output with no message — should show HTTP status and error body, (2) exit codes are inconsistent — some failures exit 1, others just echo to stderr and continue, (3) no network connectivity check before API calls, (4) jq parse errors when API returns non-JSON (e.g., HTML error pages) are swallowed. Fix: add dd_api_checked() wrapper that validates response, shows meaningful error messages, and exits with consistent codes. Key file: bin/devdash lines 53-62 (dd_api function).

title: Commit uncommitted pagination helper refactor
description: bin/devdash has uncommitted changes extracting dd_fetch_beads() and dd_fetch_jobs() helper functions, replacing 8 direct dd_api GET calls. These need to be committed and pushed before publishing. Review the diff, ensure no regressions, commit.

title: need to be able to delete a project
need to check how configuration details work so that distinct projects have dd configuration stored locally and won't have to change the global CLI env vars
need better agent instructions to tell the agent about the CLI easily
description: The 'prime' command (bin/devdash lines 758-846) generates agent workflow context. Current issues: (1) The output is comprehensive but could be more discoverable — new users/agents don't know to run 'devdash prime', (2) Could auto-detect project context better (show project name, repo URL, recent activity), (3) Should include a brief 'project health' summary (open/blocked/in_progress counts from stats), (4) Consider generating a CLAUDE.md snippet that agents can reference. The prime output is injected via SessionStart hook in Claude Code but needs to work standalone for other agent frameworks too.

title: Support short UUID prefixes in show, update, close, and dep commands
description: Commands that take a bead ID (show, update, close, dep add) passed short prefixes directly to the API, which only accepts full UUIDs. Added dd_resolve_id helper for prefix matching with ambiguity detection.

title: sync should be a specific insstruction to an agent to keep dd in sync with what's in the devdash production database for a project
description: The sync command exists in bin/devdash (lines 516-523) — it calls POST /sync/{pid}/sync-all. The pre-instructions note saying it's not implemented is STALE — sync was added. However, the sync command could be improved: (1) show what changed after sync (new/updated/closed issues), (2) add --dry-run to preview sync changes, (3) handle sync conflicts gracefully. Lower priority since basic sync works.
pre_instructions:
ROOT CAUSE DIAGNOSIS: The 'sync' command is mentioned in the README.md documentation (line listing 'sync | Sync with GitHub Issues') but is NOT implemented in bin/devdash. The CLI has a pattern for commands: each command is a bash function (dd_<command>) that calls dd_api() with appropriate HTTP method and endpoint.

IMPLEMENTATION GUIDE:
1. Read bin/devdash fully to understand the command pattern (see dd_list, dd_ready, dd_create, etc.)
2. Add a dd_sync() function following the same pattern as other commands
3. The sync command should:
   - Get the project_id using dd_project_id()
   - Call dd_api POST "/sync" with projectId in the request body
   - Handle the response and display appropriate success/error messages
4. Wire the new function into the main command dispatcher at the bottom of the script (in the case statement that matches command names)
5. Test the implementation matches the API contract (likely POST /api/sync with {"projectId": "..."})

The function should be ~10-15 lines following the existing patterns in the codebase.

title: Publish devdash-cli v0.1.0 to npm
description: Run npm publish --access public from the devdash-cli repo to publish the initial version to the npm registry. Requires: 1) npm login with an account that can publish to the unscoped 'devdash-cli' package name, 2) NPM_TOKEN secret added to the GitHub repo for CI releases. Steps: npm login, npm publish --access public, verify with npm view devdash-cli.
